sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均有"接近的"之意。
means: close ： 语气强于near。指时间、地点或程度方面的接近，有紧靠、相邻的意味。
near ： 语气弱于close，也指时间或空间上的接近，但无"紧接，接触"的含义。
nearby ： 指距离上很近，近在咫尺。
close ： 较多地用于正式或庄重的文体中，如关闭铁路、公路以及其它交通渠道，要用close。
shut ： 着重关闭的动作、过程和方式手段。
slam ： 象声词，指"砰的关上"，或用力关上。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"结束，完成"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: complete, finish, end, close, conclude, terminate, accomplish
means: complete ： 侧重指完成预定的任务或使某事完善，补足缺少的部分等。
finish ： 与complete基本同义，着重圆满地结束或完成已着手的事。
end ： 最普通用词，着重事情的完成。也指某种活动因达到目的而自然结束或由于某种原因而突然中止。
close ： 普通用词，着重行为的终止或结束，不强调其目的。
conclude ： 正式用词，多指以某事或活动达到预期目的而告终。
terminate ： 强调有一个空间和时间的限度，届时必须终止。书面语用词。
accomplish ： 正式用词，强调一个过程的完成；也可指依靠努力达到一定目的，或取得一定的结果。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含"亲密的"之意。
means: familiar ： 通常指因长期交往而彼此很熟悉，像自家人一样。
intimate ： 语气强烈，指感情或思想融洽、相互知心，彼此关系亲密。
close ： 语气较强，指兴趣爱好相同，因而关系密切，感情深笃。
confidential ： 指相互之间可推心置腹、彼此信赖。

entry.def: When you close something such as a door or lid or when it closes, it moves so that a hole, gap, or opening is covered.

example.ex: If you are cold, close the window...
example.tran: 要是冷就把窗户关上。

example.ex: Zacharias heard the door close...
example.tran: 扎卡赖亚斯听见门关上了。

entry.def: When you close something such as an open book or umbrella, you move the different parts of it together.

example.ex: Slowly he closed the book.
example.tran: 他慢慢合上书。

entry.def: If you close something such as a computer file or window, you give the computer an instruction to remove it from the screen.
entry.tran: 关闭(计算机文档、窗口等)

example.ex: To close your document, press CTRL+W on your keyboard.
example.tran: 关闭文件时要同时按键盘上的CTRL键和W键。

entry.def: When you close your eyes or your eyes close, your eyelids move downwards, so that you can no longer see.

example.ex: Bess closed her eyes and fell asleep...
example.tran: 贝丝合上眼睛睡着了。

example.ex: When we sneeze, our eyes close.
example.tran: 打喷嚏的时候眼睛会闭上。

entry.def: When a place closes or is closed, work or activity stops there for a short period.
entry.tran: (使)暂时性关闭，（使）暂停营业；关门

example.ex: Shops close only on Christmas Day and New Year's Day...
example.tran: 商店只在圣诞日和元旦停业。

example.ex: It was Saturday; they could close the office early...
example.tran: 那天是星期六，他们可以早点下班。

entry.def: If a place such as a factory, shop, or school closes, or if it is closed, all work or activity stops there permanently.
entry.tran: (工厂、商店、学校等)永久性关闭；(使)停业;(使)倒闭

example.ex: Many enterprises will be forced to close...
example.tran: 很多家企业将被迫倒闭。

example.ex: If they do close the local college I'll have to go to Worcester.
example.tran: 如果他们真把本地的大学关闭了，我就得去伍斯特上大学了。

entry.def: To close a road or border means to block it in order to prevent people from using it.

example.ex: They were cut off from the West in 1948 when their government closed that border crossing.
example.tran: 1948年政府关闭那个边境关口之后，他们便与西方国家隔绝开了。

entry.def: To close a conversation, event, or matter means to bring it to an end or to complete it.

example.ex: Judge Isabel Oliva said last night: 'I have closed the case. There was no foul play.'...
example.tran: 昨晚伊莎贝尔·奥利娃法官说：“此案我已审结，并无谋杀嫌疑。”

example.ex: He needs another $30,000 to close the deal...
example.tran: 他还需要3万美元才能做成这笔买卖。

entry.def: If you close a bank account, you take all your money out of it and inform the bank that you will no longer be using the account.
entry.tran: 结清撤销，注销(银行账户)

example.ex: He had closed his account with the bank five years earlier.
example.tran: 早在5年前他就在这家银行销户了。

entry.def: On the stock market or the currency markets, if a share price or a currency closes at a particular value, that is its value at the end of the day's business.

example.ex: Dawson shares closed at 219p, up 5p...
example.tran: 道森股票以219便士收盘，上涨了5便士。

example.ex: The US dollar closed higher in Tokyo today.
example.tran: 东京今天美元收高。

entry.def: The close of a period of time or an activity is the end of it. To bring or draw something to a close means to end it.

example.ex: By the close of business last night, most of the big firms were hailing yesterday's actions as a success...
example.tran: 昨晚交易结束的时候，多数大公司都称赞当天的活动取得了成功。

example.ex: Brian's retirement brings to a close a glorious chapter in British football history...
example.tran: 布莱恩的挂靴为英国足球史上光辉的一章画上了休止符。

entry.def: If one thing or person is close to another, there is only a very small distance between them.

example.ex: Her lips were close to his head and her breath tickled his ear...
example.tran: 她的嘴唇贴近他的头，她的呼吸让他耳朵发痒。

example.ex: The whales were too close; this posed an immediate problem for my photography...
example.tran: 鲸鱼离得太近,这成了我眼下拍摄面临的迫切问题。

entry.def: You say that people are close to each other when they like each other very much and know each other very well.

example.ex: She and Linda became very close...
example.tran: 她和琳达变得非常亲密。

example.ex: As a little girl, Karan was closest to her sister Gail...
example.tran: 卡兰小的时候和姐姐盖尔最亲。

entry.def: Your close relatives are the members of your family who are most directly related to you, for example your parents and your brothers or sisters.

example.ex: ...large changes such as the birth of a child or death of a close relative.
example.tran: 像孩子出生或近亲去世这样的大变故

entry.def: A close ally or partner of someone knows them well and is very involved in their work.
entry.tran: （盟友、伙伴）交往密切的，亲密的

example.ex: He was once regarded as one of Mr Brown's closest political advisers...
example.tran: 他曾一度被视作布朗先生最为亲信的政治顾问之一。

example.ex: A senior source close to Mr Blair told us: 'Our position has not changed.'
example.tran: 和布莱尔先生关系密切的一位高层人士告诉我们说：“我们的立场没有改变。”

entry.def: Close contact or co-operation involves seeing or communicating with someone often.

example.ex: Both nations are seeking closer links with the West...
example.tran: 两国都在寻求与西方国家建立更为紧密的联系。

example.ex: He lived alone, keeping close contact with his three grown-up sons.
example.tran: 他一个人住，与3个已经长大成人的儿子经常联系。

entry.def: If there is a close connection or resemblance between two things, they are strongly connected or are very similar.

example.ex: There is a close connection between pain and tension...
example.tran: 疼痛和紧张之间有着紧密的联系。

example.ex: Clare's close resemblance to his elder sister invoked a deep dislike in him.
example.tran: 克莱尔酷似他姐姐，这引起他极大的反感。

entry.def: Close inspection or observation of something is careful and thorough.

example.ex: He discovered, on closer inspection, that the rocks contained gold...
example.tran: 经过更为仔细的探察，他发现这些岩石含金。

example.ex: All these definitions, while sounding impressive, do not stand up under close scrutiny...
example.tran: 所有这些定义虽然听上去煞有其事，但都经不起推敲。

entry.def: A close competition or election is won or seems likely to be won by only a small amount.
entry.tran: (竞争或选举)势均力敌的，难分高下的

example.ex: It is still a close contest between two leading opposition parties...
example.tran: 这仍然是两大主要反对党之间一场势均力敌的较量。

example.ex: It's going to be very close.
example.tran: 结果会不相上下。

entry.def: If you are close to something or if it is close, it is likely to happen or come soon. If you are close to doing something, you are likely to do it soon.

example.ex: She sounded close to tears...
example.tran: 她听上去要哭了。

example.ex: Drought has left more than two million people close to starvation...
example.tran: 干旱让两百多万人濒临饿死。

entry.def: If something is close or comes close to something else, it almost is, does, or experiences that thing.

example.ex: There is a simplicity about the interior which comes close to blandness...
example.tran: 室内布置得很简单，几乎有点平淡无奇。

example.ex: An airliner came close to disaster while approaching Heathrow Airport...
example.tran: 一架大型客机在飞近希思罗机场时差点儿发生空难。

entry.def: If the atmosphere somewhere is close, it is unpleasantly warm with not enough air.
Something that is close by or close at hand is near to you.

example.ex: Did a new hairdressing shop open close by?...
example.tran: 附近是不是新开了一家理发店？

example.ex: His wife remains behind in Germany, but Jason, his 18-year-old son, is closer at hand.
example.tran: 他的妻子还留在德国，但他18岁的儿子贾森就在身边。

entry.def: If you describe an event as a close shave, a close thing, or a close call, you mean that an accident or a disaster very nearly happened.

example.ex: You had a close shave, but you knew when you accepted this job that there would be risks.
example.tran: 你这次侥幸脱险，不过在接受这项工作的时候，你就知道会有一些危险。

entry.def: If you keep a close eye on someone or something or keep a close watch on them, you observe them carefully to make sure they are progressing as you want them to.

example.ex: The President's foreign policy team are keeping a close eye on events.
example.tran: 总统的外交政策团队正密切关注事态发展。

entry.def: Close to a particular amount or distance means slightly less than that amount or distance. In British English, you can also say close on a particular amount or distance.

example.ex: Sisulu spent close to 30 years in prison...
example.tran: 西苏卢在监狱里度过了将近30年的时光。

example.ex: Close to 50,000 people took part...
example.tran: 近5万人参加。

entry.def: If you look at something close up or close to, you look at it when you are very near to it.

example.ex: They always look smaller close up.
example.tran: 凑近看时，它们总是显得小一些。

entry.def: If something such as a competition or an election is too close to call, it is not possible to predict who will win because it seems likely to be won by only a very small margin.

example.ex: In the Senate, the count is too close to call at this point.
example.tran: 参议院现在的票数还难分上下。

entry.def: If you are closing on someone or something that you are following, you are getting nearer and nearer to them.

example.ex: I was within 15 seconds of the guy in second place and closing on him.
example.tran: 我和处在第二名的男子相差不到15秒，而且正在逐渐赶上他。

entry.def: Close is used in the names of some streets in Britain.
entry.tran: (用于英国的一些街名中)巷，小街

example.ex: ...116 Dendridge Close.
example.tran: 登德里奇巷116号

3. the concluding part of any performance
1. cease to operate or cause to cease operating;

sentences.sentence: "The owners decided to move and to close the factory"

means.word_mean: 2. complete a business deal, negotiation, or an agreement;

sentences.sentence: "We closed on the house on Friday"
"They closed the deal on the building"

means.word_mean: 3. move so that an opening or passage is obstructed; make shut;

sentences.sentence: "Due to the accident, the road had to be closed for several hours"
"The meeting was closed with a charge by the chairman of the board"
"The probe closed with the space station"
"The concert closed with a nocturne by Chopin"
"The windows closed with a loud bang"

means.word_mean: 9. come together, as if in an embrace;

sentences.sentence: "Her arms closed around her long lost relative"

means.word_mean: 10. unite or bring into contact or bring together the edges of;
11. bring together all the elements or parts of;
13. be priced or listed when trading stops;

sentences.sentence: "The stock market closed high this Friday"
"My new stocks closed at $59 last night"

means.word_mean: 14. cause a window or an application to disappear on a computer desktop
15. change one's body stance so that the forward shoulder and foot are closer to the intended point of impact

sentences.sentence: "Can you close the cracks with caulking?"

means.word_mean: 17. finish a game in baseball by protecting a lead;

sentences.sentence: "The relief pitcher closed with two runs in the second inning"

means.word_mean: 1. at or within a short distance in space or time or having elements near each other;
3. not far distant in time or space or degree or circumstances;
5. marked by fidelity to an original;

sentences.sentence: "a faithful rendering of the observed facts"

means.word_mean: 6. (of a contest or contestants) evenly matched;

sentences.sentence: "hot and stuffy and the air was blue with smoke"
"smooth percale with a very tight weave"

means.word_mean: 15. inclined to secrecy or reticence about divulging information;

sentences.sentence: "although they knew her whereabouts her friends kept close about it"

means.word_mean: 1. near in time or place or relationship;

sentences.sentence: "don't get too close to the fire"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French clos (as noun and adjective), from Latin clausum 'enclosure' and clausus 'closed', past participle of claudere
Middle English: from Old French clos-, stem of clore, from Latin claudere 'to shut'
